CLUE: Branch of linguistics concerned with meanings
FOUND IN: Semantics is the subfield of linguistics that studies the meaning of language, including the meaning of words, phrases, sentences, and larger linguistic structures
Variety: There are several species of snails that are commonly consumed in France, including the Helix pomatia (the most common), Helix aspersa (the Roman snail), and Helix bullata (the garden snail)
